tweets.text:
Well, let‚Äôs see what the 30th April brings.   Interesting that a study in Italy found people living within 3 miles of a landfill were 34% more likely to suffer lung disease.  

Good job that UK landfills are run so well and no cutbacks at the EA ü§î

#StopTheStink https://t.co/ciBOvPmNtA https://t.co/csgNZ5HdZV
@EnvAgencyMids Only when we no longer breathe toxic, poisonous, life destroying gasses rather than air, only then will this mean ANYTHING #STOPTHESTINK

The air purifiers have started to go out to people in need. @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency  Look at this poor woman's eyes! This cannot be allowed to go on. Hang your heads in shame #capitoff #stopthestink https://t.co/g7kUIqLdzd

A cold day with a bitter North wind seems to be delaying the arrival of many migrants. One new arrival was a male Marsh Harrier that hunted successfully over what remains (25% removed by @EnvAgency ) of the reed bed on Pilning Wetland. It also flushed out 3 Green Sandpipers. https://t.co/fupwBI3dgv

Private water companies have been treating our rivers like sewers for far too long. 

It's time to bring our water into public ownership.

https://t.co/Di0UrGG13w

@EnvAgencyMids Have a look at some real data, recorded by residents on calibrated detection machines  
http://86.27.7.64:1001/Newcastle/?fbclid=IwAR0sx7nRP79Y8La_05lFvo3pgDGhD1NqEpOmYn251V9d8gsZLROD2lltxIw
@EnvAgencyMids Did your review on the 13th show any reason for the increased complaints and smell?  Rather worrying that we are 2 weeks from the 30th and the smell is getting worse.
@EnvAgencyMids Made any visits to surrounding Stoke on trent areas? We are also being poisoned on a daily basis!!

@poppers82 @EnvAgencyMids @scottdegg So all within permit, and therein lies the problem, too many extensions and changes to what is allowed in landfill feet from human life, @AaronBell4NUL labour govt forced this upon us years ago as non toxic, non odour builders waste, rubble, bricks, new permits disgrace.

@EnvAgencyMids @scottdegg Still don‚Äôt give a s**t in my opinion. We just want to know why we are being gassed in our own homes. Just let us know what your doing to stop the odious smell from coming into my safe space please. You need to cover SOT when monitoring odours also it‚Äôs not just NUL by the way

@EnvAgencyMids It‚Äôs 3 weeks since you collected samples of water from the burst pipe on the site.   Have you finished analysing yet ?
Why haven‚Äôt we heard about the analysis?

Read our latest update for #WalleysQuarry landfill site here üëâhttps://t.co/o558iAVicn

We're visiting the surrounding area on an almost daily basis to carry out odour amenity checks. We're also continuing to inspect the site, including monitoring the progress of the capping. https://t.co/FsLQlvsU0f

@EnvAgencyMids Let‚Äôs hope all this ENDLESS monitoring will actually mean some progress. This can‚Äôt go on. Whatever deal you have going with them whatever your arrangement with them. You need to sort it out regardless of anything. We will not accept more ‚Äòmonitoring‚Äô we need answers and resolve

tweets.text: We can‚Äôt breathe upstairs. We received a letter today from the @EnvAgency after suffering since we moved here in 2016 - it feels like a kick in the teeth that it‚Äôs taken this long for the EA to do anything. In the pocket of Red #StopTheStink @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk

@nelliephant @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @JamesBevanEA Yes good plan @EnvAgency @ClareDinnisEA - let's cut down half a rain forrest to write letters to tell them what they already know. You could have put that money to better use & buy air purifiers to help the people that are being poisoned and you are facilitating it #stopthestink
Please see Land & Water's statement below regarding work at Bishopsford Bridge. https://t.co/taBbbErn1L

I honestly cannot remember the last time I wasn‚Äôt woke up by the #walleysquarry gases or waking up to find it all in the house. This is getting SO out of hand it is scary. We can‚Äôt live like this. It is torture. #stopthestink @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids @PHE_WestMids https://t.co/mMwXKzP3FY
Could you pinpoint it over walleys quarry landfill in Silverdale Newcastle under Lyme please, our town is suffering from the gases emitted from it! @StinkStopthe https://t.co/YWIO8Qz0S5

urls.title: Leyton: Introduction | British History Online
urls.description: Leyton, the 'tun' on the river Lea, lies about 5 miles north-east of London between the river and Epping Forest. It is part of the London borough of Waltham Forest. (fn. 1) It is mainly a dormitory suburb of small houses built between 1870 and 1910, interspersed with modern block and tower housing. Industry is dispersed, apart from the Temple Mills railway complex in the southwest and a concentration of factories in the north-west. The ancient parish was known as Low Leyton, because part of it lay low by
